import.errorParse: Could not parse the TypeScript code. Make sure it's a valid interface or type declaration.

newSchema.title: New Schema
newSchema.description: Create a new schema from scratch

help.title: How to Use ZodSmith
help.gettingStartedContent: ZodSmith is a visual builder for creating Zod schemas. You can define your data models visually and generate TypeScript code automatically.
help.creatingSchemaContent: Click "New Schema" in the sidebar or use a template to get started. Give your schema a name and optional description.
help.addingFieldsContent: Use the "Add Field" button to create new fields. Each field has a name, type, and optional validations.
help.fieldTypesContent: Supported types include String, Number, Boolean, Date, Enum, and Array. Each type has specific validations available.
help.validationsContent: Click on a field to edit its validations. String fields can have min/max length, email format, etc. Number fields can have ranges and constraints.
help.codePreviewContent: Click the code button on the right to see generated Zod schema, TypeScript types, or a full module with both.
help.savingSchemaContent: Your schemas are automatically saved to local storage. You can manage them from the sidebar.
help.templatesContent: Use pre-built templates for common schemas like User, Product, Address, etc. Templates give you a starting point that you can customize.
help.tip2: Click a field to edit its properties
help.tip3: Use templates to get started quickly

helpDialog.title: How to Use ZodSmith
helpDialog.description: Visual builder for creating Zod schemas and TypeScript types

createSchema.title: Create a Schema
createSchema.description: Click 'New Schema' in the sidebar or use the 'Create New Schema' button to start building your data model.

useTemplates.title: Use Templates
useTemplates.description: Choose from predefined templates like User, Product, Address, or API Response to quickly start with common schema patterns.

importTs.title: Import TypeScript
importTs.description: Paste an existing TypeScript interface or type definition to automatically convert it into a visual schema.

addFields.title: Add Fields
addFields.description: Click 'Add Field' and select a type: string, number, boolean, date, enum, or array. Each field type has its own validation options.

reorderFields.title: Reorder Fields
reorderFields.description: Drag and drop fields using the grip handle on the left side to reorder them in your schema.

configureValidations.title: Configure Validations
configureValidations.description: Click on any field to open the editor panel and configure validations like length limits, formats, regex patterns, and more.

required.title: Required Fields
required.description: Toggle the 'Required' switch to make a field mandatory. Required fields will fail validation if not provided.

nullable.title: Nullable Fields
nullable.description: Enable 'Nullable' to allow null values for a field. The generated type will include '| null'.

defaultValue.title: Default Values
defaultValue.description: Set a default value that will be used when the field is not provided in the input data.

fieldTypes.title: Field Types & Validations
fieldTypes.string: min/max length, exact length, email, url, uuid, cuid, regex, startsWith, endsWith, includes, trim, lowercase, uppercase
fieldTypes.number: min/max, integer, finite, positive, negative, non-negative, non-positive, multipleOf
fieldTypes.enum: Define a list of allowed string values
fieldTypes.array: item type, min/max items, exact length, non-empty

previewTabs.title: Preview Tabs
previewTabs.description: Click the code button on the right to open the preview. Switch between Zod Schema, TypeScript types, and Full Module views.

copyCode.title: Copy Code
copyCode.description: Click the copy button to copy the generated code to your clipboard, ready to paste into your project.

outputSettings.title: Output Settings
outputSettings.description: Configure the output style: choose between z.infer, interface, or type. Customize semicolons, comments, exports, and naming conventions.

saveSchema.title: Save Schema
saveSchema.description: Click 'Save' to store your schema in local storage. Saved schemas appear in the 'Schemas' tab of the sidebar.

duplicate.title: Duplicate Schema
duplicate.description: Use the duplicate option in the schema menu to create a copy. Perfect for creating variations without starting over.

theme.title: Theme
theme.description: Toggle between light and dark mode using the theme button in the header. Your preference is saved automatically.

language.title: Language
language.description: Switch between available languages using the language selector. The interface will update immediately.

tips.title: Tips & Best Practices
tips.pascalCase: Use PascalCase for schema names (e.g., UserProfile, ProductData)
tips.camelCase: Use camelCase for field names (e.g., firstName, createdAt)
tips.dragDrop: Drag fields to reorder them - the order is preserved in generated code
tips.realTime: Generated code updates in real-time as you make changes

user.name: User
user.description: Basic user account schema with authentication fields

product.name: Product
product.description: E-commerce product schema with pricing and inventory

address.name: Address
address.description: Postal address schema for shipping and billing
